Series.Actors: |Will Smith|Alfonso Ribeiro|Jazzy Jeff|James Avery|Tatyana Ali|Janet Hubert-Whitten|Karyn Parsons|Joseph Marcell|Daphne Maxwell Reid|Ross Bagley|Charlayne Woodard|Tina Lifford|Diedrich Bader|Jenifer Lewis|Morgan Nagler|Tisha Campbell|
Series.Overview: A wealthy family living in Bel-Air, California, receives a dubious gift from their poorer relations in Philadelphia when Grammy Award-winner Will Smith arrives as The Fresh Prince Of Bel-Air. His mother wants him to learn some good old-fashioned values from his successful relatives. But Will shatters the sophisticated serenity of Bel-Air with his streetwise common sense, much to the dismay of his upper-crust uncle, Philip Banks (James Avery), Aunt Vivian (Janet Hubert-Whitten and Daphne Maxwell Reid) and three conceited cousins, Carlton (Alfonso Ribeiro), Hilary (Karyn Parsons) and Ashley (Tatyana Ali) - and even the butler, Geoffrey (Joseph Marcell). As the Banks family opens their home - and their checkbook - to their needy relative, Will adapts easily to their indulgent lifestyle. Yet, he reminds everyone that the simplest pleasures of family life can't be bought at any price. Repeats can be seen on Nick at Nite, The N (Noggin's nightime program lineup), and weekday afternoons

Episode.Overview: Aunt Vivian tries to mediate between her husband Philip and the newly arrived Will.
Will persuades Ashley to pawn her violin for a drum set.

Episode.GuestStars: |Richard Roundtree|Victoria Rowell|Garon Grigsby|John Towney|Tatiana Thumbtzen|Lisa Fuller|
Episode.Overview: Will wants to go out with a beautiful girl he meets at the country club, but first he must figure out how to impress her extremely snobbish and very protective fatherâ€”so he seeks tips from cousin Carlton on becoming preppie.

Episode.EpisodeName: Not With My Pig, You Don't
Episode.GuestStars: |David Downing|Gilbert Lewis|Kathy Griffin|Lewis Gilbert|Jim Mapp|Jeffrey Hayenga|Helen Page Camp|
Episode.Overview: Will tries to smooth things between Philip and his very rural parents when they visit to see him receive an award.
Will gets a visit from an old pal named Ice Tray, who, to Vivian and Philip's dismay, warms up to Hilary.

Episode.GuestStars: |Hank Azaria|Dan Desmond|Raymond McLeod|Anthony Auer|Donald Grant|Helen Page Camp|
Episode.Overview: Jailed, Will and Carlton stage a media stunt.
Will joins his prep school's poetry club.

Episode.EpisodeName: Someday Your Prince Will Be in Effect (Part 1)
Episode.GuestStars: |Tler Collins|Paris Vaughn|Tim Russ|Kelly Connell|Patricia Clipper|Mike Barr|DeEdyre J. Burks|Kymberly Newberry|Gina Ravera|Samm-Art Williams|Anastasia N. Ali|Bo Jackson|Quincy Jones|Kadeem Hardison|Malcolm-Jamal Warner|A. B. Sure!|Dwight Heavy D Myers|
Episode.Overview: When Will and Carlton compete for dates for a Hallowe'en party, Will boasts of knowing famous people (seen in fantasy flashbacks).

Episode.EpisodeName: Someday Your Prince Will Be in Effect (Part 2)
Episode.GuestStars: |Tler Collins|Paris Vaughn|Tim Russ|Kelly Connell|Patricia Clipper|Mike Barr|DeEdyre J. Burks|Kymberly Newberry|Gina Ravera|Samm-Art Williams|Anastasia N. Ali|Bo Jackson|Quincy Jones|Kadeem Hardison|Malcolm-Jamal Warner|A. B. Sure!|Dwight Heavy D Myers|
Episode.Overview: When Will and Carlton compete for dates for a Halloween party, Will boasts of knowing famous people (seen in fantasy flashbacks).
Will and Carlton surprise Geoffrey on his birthday with a gorgeous blind dateâ€“whom Will promptly falls for, only to be outshone by Geoffrey.

Episode.GuestStars: |Michael Landes|Isaiah Thomas|Ron Perkins|Jonathan Emerson|Michael Weiner|Keith Bogart|Bill Cort|
Episode.Overview: Carlton feels overshadowed by Will, who's become a basketball star at school.
A holiday visit from Will's taskmaster mother puts the kibosh on conspicuous consumption and puts the kids to work preparing Thanksgiving dinner.
Hilary becomes Will's personal maid when he threatens to disclose she's dropped out of UCLA.

Episode.GuestStars: |Michael Landes|James Tolkan|Patrick Van Horn|Ashley Bank|Nichole Francois|Jonathan Emerson|Michael Weiner|Keith Bogart|Bill Cort|
Episode.Overview: Will tells Ashley's slumber-party guests a scary tale about his first day at Bel-Air Academy.

Episode.GuestStars: |Michael Landes|Evander Holyfield|John Roarke|Taylor Negron|Mike Pniewski|Richard Roat|Rodney Kageyama|Justin Shenkarow|Shirley Mitchell|Valerie Jones|Mark Morales|Darneica Corley|Keith Bogart|
Episode.Overview: Will inimitably dresses the mansion for the holidays, to the dismay of the neighbors, including heavyweight boxing champion Evander Holyfield.
Philip may lose a superstitious client whom he advises not to make decisions based on Will's spontaneous remarks.
Will proposes a black history class be instituted at Bel-Air Academy, and gets a surprise when Aunt Viv arrives to teach it.
Will sneaks Philip's elderly mother out of the house for a night on the town.
Will has girl problems after a date with Jazz's domineering sister, who's ready to pick out a china pattern before the night is over.
Fresh Prince Will is on his best behavior for visiting royalty -- the seemingly demure Lady Penelope, who Will hopes to persuade to let herself have a good time at a party.
Jasmine Guy plays a scholarship student whose introduction to Will opens up a different world of fun and games -- and romance -- to divert her from her studies.

Episode.GuestStars: |J.D. Hall|Hugh Dane|Angela Gordon|Jeff Chayette|Michelle Simms|Tanya Moore|
Episode.Overview: Will crawls to Philip for help after sneaking out on the town and getting hustled by sleazy pool sharks.

Episode.GuestStars: |Miguel Nunez| Jr.|Tom 'Tiny' Lister Jr.|J'vonne Pearson|Richard Gloria|Larry Jones|Rodney Knoll|Mark Moralez|Jamy Woodbury|
Episode.Overview: Will challenges Carlton to spend time in a tough neighborhood, trying to survive by masquerading as a financial consultant.
R&B singer Tevin Campbell plays teen idol Little T, who surprises Ashley on her birthday with a special song and an invitation for a date.
Rap's Queen Latifah plays Hilary's new actress boss, who wants Will as her boy toy -- or Hilary's glamorous job is over.

Episode.EpisodeName: Did the Earth Move for You?
Episode.Overview: Will's all-consumed romance with a new girlfriend shakes up the Banks' household, as does Mother Nature, trapping them together during an earthquake.
Will and Carlton arrive as reinforcements when a bully challenges Ashley to a rumble, but there's real trouble when Philip and Vivian intervene.

Will tries to juggle school and a new job in order to earn money for the homecoming party; Ashley's classmate Tina becomes interested in Carlton. Will starts becoming paranoid when he constantly is getting confused with Carlton.
Will is a picture of confidence, while Carlton is a frazzled bundle of nerves preparing for college aptitude tests.
Mortified over spying his mother kiss the handyman, Philip can't bear to think of her having a new man in her life.

Episode.GuestStars: |Diedrich Bader|David Downing|Charlayne Woodard|Felton Perry|Clyde Jones|Ahmad Stoner|Zaid Farid|Jenifer Lewis|
Episode.Overview: Tensions spill over just before the wedding of Will's Aunt Janice when Will's mom meets Janice's intended -- and forbids Will to attend the interracial wedding.
Vivian's 40th birthday marks a crisis and a career change in which she plans to perfect her dance skills.

Episode.GuestStars: |Queen Latifah|Nia Long|S. Kyle Parker|Michael Weiner|Keith Bogart|Vincent Ventresca|Duane Taniguchi|
Episode.Overview: Will hits it off with the full-figured Dee Dee, but her size keeps him from asking her to the dance.
A pompous lawyer who's dating Hilary is no fan of Will's after he's sideswiped by Will's roadster.
Will and Carlton think a party guest stole the silverware.

Episode.GuestStars: |Nicholle Tom|Ronnie DeVoe|Ricky Bell|Michael Bivins|David Bowe|Shawn Murray|Ralph Manza|Bell Biv DeVoe|
Episode.Overview: Bell Biv DeVoe shoots a video at the Bankses, courtesy of Carlton, who rents the house while his parents are away.

Episode.GuestStars: |Brandon Quintin Adams|Don Amendolia|Richard Penn|John Petlock|Mimi Cozzens|Andrew Bilgore|
Episode.Overview: After winning at the country club's Monte Carlo night fund-raiser, Will learns that he's expected to donate the money to charity.

Episode.GuestStars: |Diedrich Bader|Felton Perry|Don Sparks|Charley Lang|Charlayne Woodard|Ahmad Stoner|Tom Virtue|Jenifer Lewis|
Episode.Overview: On a family ski trip, the Banks find that they must come up with Christmas gifts from the heart after their belongings are stolen.
Hilary must work for a caterer after her credit cards are cancelled.
On the basketball court, winning is everything to Will, as it is to an opponent from Malibu Prep, who can't afford to lose.

Episode.GuestStars: |Kathy Griffin|Anna Maria Horsford|Jay Bell|Matthew Faison|Marj Dusay|E.R. Davies|John Towey|Daniel Trent|
Episode.Overview: Geoffrey falls hard for a neighbor he believes is a housekeeper -- but who turns out to be very wealthy.
When Hillary is ordered to do community service at a free clinic, the doctor in charge becomes the antidote for her marriage-mindedness.

Episode.GuestStars: |Bernie Kopell|Dr. Dre|Macon McCalman|Kathleen McClennan|John Beradino|Debra Mooney|Erick Avari|Milton Berle|
Episode.Overview: The family fears a steamy exposÃ© when Geoffrey begins his memoirs, while Will fears the scalpel when he enters the hospital, kicking and screaming, for a tonsillectomy.
Needing a game show partner, Will must choose between bickering friends.
Philip and Vivian welcome a '60s radical, who arouses the FBI's interest and influences Will and Carlton to take action over the firing of a nonconformist teacher.
Will dislikes his mother's new boyfriend.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Aunt Who Came to Dinner
Episode.GuestStars: |Felton Perry|Kent Masters King|Monique Mannen|Hawthorne James|Arnold Johnson|Jenifer Lewis|
Episode.Overview: Aunt Helen arrives unexpectedly, and upsets Will and Carlton's plans for a rendezvous with two French women.

Ashley cringes when the family oohs and aahs over her relationship with Kevin , but Will chokes when she asks him about sex -- and her curiosity about reproduction sends Will to a pregnancy counseling center.

Episode.GuestStars: |Mother Love|Marius Mazmanian|Viva Vinson|Marge Kotlisky|Paige Pengra|Beverly Jackson|
Episode.Overview: Will and Carlton lose their shirts investing on a tip -- then take jobs as strippers to recoup their losses and get Vivian's bracelet out of hock.

Episode.EpisodeName: How I Spent My Summer Vacation
Episode.Overview: Will returns home from spending the summer in Philadelphia with a new look that doesn't sit well with Uncle Phil.

Episode.GuestStars: |Gregory Sierra|Rose Jackson|LaRite Shelby|Valerie Jones|Shavar Ross|Michael Waley|Floyd Roger Myers|Gary Leroi Gray|
Episode.Overview: Philip and Vivian organize a cleanup effort in the riot-torn remains of their old LA neighborhood.

Episode.EpisodeName: That's No Lady, That's My Cousin
Episode.Overview: Enrolled at the newly coed Bel-Air Prep, Ashley begins dressing to entice guys, using Will's preferences in women as her examples; Will and Carlton's prep school goes coed.
Hilary gets a job reporting weather on television.
Philip intends to railroad off the bench ineffectual Judge Robertson; and Will becomes the ""love slave"" of a flamboyantly generous plain student.

Episode.GuestStars: |Lark Voorhies|Roxanne Beckford|Lahmard Tate|Gregory White|Jonathan Kennedy|Jeremiah Kennedy|
Episode.Overview: Carlton prepares for a dinner date with his former girlfriend, Cindy, forgiving her for rejecting him several months earlier, but when she arrives with a newborn baby named Carlton Jr., the entire Banks family is stunned. Philip refuses to believe that the baby is his grandchild until a blood test proves it; Vivian reprimands Cindy for not coming to them for advice. Will, however, suspects that the inexperienced Carlton never had a chance to father a baby. Determined to accept his responsibility, Carlton elopes with Cindy to a small-town chapel. While waiting for the preacher to marry them, they realize that they're too young and too incompatible to spend the rest of their lives together. When Will arrives at the chapel to stop the ceremony, he learns that Cindy has confessed that Carlton wasn't the baby's father and called her parents to take her home, leaving Carlton bewildered and heartbroken. Carlton meekly confesses to Will that he's still a virgin, but was willing to marry Cindy,
Will gets arrested for numerous parking tickets as Phil runs for judge against incumbent Judge Robertson.
Philip takes Will and Carlton on a camping trip that turns out to be a disaster when snow traps the unhappy campers.

Episode.GuestStars: |Oprah Winfrey|Lou Felder|Victoria Morsell|Mary Kate Harris|Deborah Swisher|General James|
Episode.Overview: The Bankses appear on Oprah's show and fail to invite Will on-stage, which may cause Philip to lose the election.

Election results are in and Philip fights to remain cool amid lies by Judge Robertson, which prompt Will to confront the outspoken incumbent. Will Will go to far? Will he say what everyone is feeling? Will Judge Robertson be able to take it?

Episode.EpisodeName: A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum
Episode.Overview: At Vivian's Lamaze class, Will cozies up to a pregnant sportswriter, who takes him to a game -- and delivers more than just fun.

Carlton Banks is very depressed after being rejected by Paula, unaware that she has left him for Will. Meanwhile, Philip and Vivian receive an envelope from their doctor containing an ultrasound picture revealing the sex of Vivian's fetus. Not wanting to spoil their surprise in the delivery room, they entrust the sealed envelope to their butler, Geoffrey ...then curiosity gets the better of them.

Episode.GuestStars: |Jenifer Lewis|Charlayne Woodard|Royce Wallace|Robert Torti|Ed Cambridge Jr.|Scotty Brulee|Vernee Watson-Johnson|
Episode.Overview: Will's mother tells Will that she's broken her engagement to Robert and eagerly awaits her son's graduation so they can return to Philadelphia together. A shocked Will is afraid to tell her that he wants to attend college in California and remain with his Bel-Air family and friends, and suffers a nightmarish fantasy of what it would be like still living with his mother when he's 60 years old.
Will and Carlton convince Geoffrey that he has won a multimillion dollar lottery.

Episode.GuestStars: |M. C. Gainey|Phil LaMarr|Tom Virtue|June Christopher|Rolandas Hendricks|
Episode.Overview: Philip is quick to judge an ex-con Will urged him to hire as a handyman and temporary assistant after the house is robbed.

As Vivian's delivery date approaches, the family fantasizes about what the baby will mean to each of them: Ashley feels all but invisible, Geoffrey feels overwhelmed by the family's demands, and Vivian feels like she's having triplets.
Will tries to dupe a girl into intimacy.
Princeton accepts Will but rejects Carlton -- whose guardian angel helps him see the light.
Will learns a sobering lesson after Carlton pops the wrong pills from Will's locker, mistaking amphetamines for vitamins, and winds up in hospital.
Vivian's baby is a week late, but family members and her visiting sisters are nowhere to be found when it's time to rush to the hospital.
Heavyweight boxing champ Riddick Brown wreaks havoc with Carlton's mind and Will's face at a funky cafe-casino in Nevada, where the cousins have stopped on their way to check out a college for Will.

Episode.EpisodeName: Ain't No Business Like Show Business
Episode.GuestStars: |Susan Isaacs|Greg Travis|D.L. Hughley|Bernadette Luckett|Lisa Marie Todd|Herman Cox|
Episode.Overview: Will lands a spot in a comedy showcase after accompanying a comic friend to an audition.
Series clips illustrate family recollections as the kids put together a scrapbook for Vivian and Philip, who want to renew their vows on their anniversary.

Episode.GuestStars: |Rosalind Cash|Anne Wyndham|Paige Tomada|Brian Levinson|Kimberly Cullum|Karen Kirkland|Delane Vaughn|Monica Lundry|Bill Cort|
Episode.Overview: Vy anticipates Will's graduation with enthusiasm, but there may be discord when she learns Will is failing music. To pass his music class, Will must sing at the graduation ceremony -- with a class of eight-year-olds.

Episode.EpisodeName: Where There's a Will, There's a Way (1)
Episode.Overview: College-bound Will and Carlton settle into their new L.A. party pad, to which Carlton brings the woman of his dreams -- Jackie. Unfortunately, it is also soon overrun with partygoers.

Episode.EpisodeName: Where There's a Will, There's a Way (2)
Episode.Overview: Will brings Carlton shocking news that Jackie is an old friend of his from Philly; the two guys get evicted from their apartment; and Hilary asks for a ""special"" proposal from Trevor -- and gets it.
Registration day finds Will signing up for no-brainer classes, plus one that might truly challenge him -- a philosophy course he takes to meet a girl.
Stuck with caring for Nicky for the day, Will soon discovers the benefits of baby-sitting: he's suddenly a big man on campus with the women so long as he poses as a single dad.

Episode.EpisodeName: It's Better to Have Loved and Lost It...
Episode.Overview: After Will's friends guys rib Carlton about being a virgin, Miss Right (Belcon) appears and sweeps Carlton off his feet. Elsewhere, Geoffrey confesses a secret of his own.
When Phillip sues Will and Carlton for unpaid rent, two different versions of the dispute are aired -- neither entirely truthful.

Hilary summons an outrageous TV psychic and spirit channeler who arranges a sÃ©ance to communicate with the dead and enable Hilary to get over Trevor once and for all -- and hexes a disbelieving Will.

Episode.GuestStars: |Glenn Plummer|Mushond Lee|Tanya Baetz|Steven King|David Drew Gallagher|Ryan Holihan|Rob Moore|Gregory Fleming|Steve Minsky|Scott Michael Morgan|
Episode.Overview: Will and Carlton try to get accepted into an African-American fraternity; Will proves to be just what they want in a pledge, but one of the brothers sees Carlton as a ""prep-school, Bel Air-bred sellout.""

Episode.GuestStars: |Hugh Hefner|Tawni Cable|Lorraine Olivia|PÃ­a Reyes|Cady Cantrell|Samantha Dorman|
Episode.Overview: Will breaks a date with Jackie to accompany Hilary to a Playboy Mansion reception for weather reporters being photographed for the magazine.

Episode.EpisodeName: Home is Where the Heart Attack Is
Episode.Overview: Will sneaks greasy, high-fat foods to Philip after he promises to diet and exercise, then blames himself when Philip has a heart attack.

Episode.GuestStars: |Phil Morris|Rachel True|Harriet Medin|Leonard M. Weltman|Billy West|
Episode.Overview: On academic probation, Will schemes to improve his grades by fixing up a newly divorced English professor with Hilary, who soon finds fault with the man, further jeopardizing Will's academic future.

Episode.EpisodeName: You've Got to Be a Football Hero
Episode.GuestStars: |Cylk Cozart|Robin Quivers|Craig Shoemaker|Paul Ganus|DeJuan Guy|Matt Moore|Marc Robinson|
Episode.Overview: Will uses booze to prove his manliness while competing with a hulking football hero who wants to score points with Jackie, and his fraternity brothers leave drunken Will in a cemetery, where he is haunted. Meanwhile, Ashley learns that beauty is in the eye of the beholder.

Episode.GuestStars: |Charlie Mack|Sullivan Walker|Boyz II Men|Jenifer Lewis|Shawn Stockman|
Episode.Overview: Vivian promises god-motherhood of her child to both of her sisters, while Will hatches a harebrained scheme to get Boyz II Men to perform at baby Nicky's christening.
Will pays for putting off studying for a midterm until the last minute, and Ashley pays for staying out late on her first date.

Episode.GuestStars: |Rick Fitts|Jay Arlen Jones|Mark Arnott|Christa Miller Lawrence|
Episode.Overview: Business drops off at the Peacock Stop when Carlton takes over as manager; elsewhere, an ""I Hate Hilary"" newsletter precipitates stormy weather.

Episode.EpisodeName: I Know Why the Caged Bird Screams
Episode.Overview: Will and Jazz steal a statue from a rival school, whose team retaliates by kidnapping ULA's lucky charm -- Carlton, the strutting peacock mascot.

Episode.EpisodeName: When You Hit Upon a Star
Episode.Overview: Will becomes a jet-setter while dating a pop star.

Episode.EpisodeName: Stop Will! In the Name of Love
Episode.GuestStars: |Branford Marsalis|Tara Davis|Brandon Quintin Adams|Thomas Bellin|David Tyler|Amy Hunter|
Episode.Overview: A Valentine's double date finds Will treating Ashley like a kid and Ashley demanding r-e-s-p-e-c-t.
A car dealer hires Will, then persuades him to drop out of college.
Philip foots the bill when Jazz decides to marry a jailbird -- who moves in on Will.
An overprotective dad takes Will flying to scare him out of getting too serious with his daughter.

Episode.EpisodeName: M is for the Many Things She Gave Me
Episode.Overview: It's double trouble for Will when Philip's old flame visits with her daughter, who's attracted to Will.

Episode.GuestStars: |Pat Crawford Brown|Kenya Moore|Eddie Gorodetsky|Tarpon London|Karen Malina White|
Episode.Overview: Newlyweds Jazz and Jewel try to start a family, but it turns out they're going to need a little help -- from Will; Phil urges the kids to give Vivian thoughtful Mother's Day gifts.
Ben Vereen plays Will's long-lost father, who breezes into town and promises Will the moon, which angers an unforgiving Philip.
A stranger makes a generous offer for the Banks estate, which prompts the family to reminisce about their good times there.

Episode.GuestStars: |Dick Clark|Robert Costanzo|Daryl Chill Mitchell|Reno Wilson|Jacques Apollo Bolton|Jeri Gray|Loretta Jean|Ernest Tron Anderson|
Episode.Overview: Will returns to the City of Brotherly Love and discovers he's the butt of old friends' jokes, prompting him to go into training to settle an old score and clear his reputation as a chicken.

Episode.EpisodeName: What's Will Got to Do With It? (1)
Episode.Overview: Will manages the rising singing career of Ashley, who becomes a prima donna.
Philip and Will don't see eye to eye on Ashley's singing career, but record producer Gordy Berry is all ears.

Episode.GuestStars: |Monty Hoffman|Dick O'Neill|Leeza Gibbons|Leanne Griffin|Stephanie Sawyer|Bill Stevenson|
Episode.Overview: Will loses points as a role model for Nicky while visiting an ever-positive kiddie hero who brings joy to youngsters -- but not to Will.
Will blasts Carlton for stealing his woman while on a double date, and their ensuing fight lasts for days -- until Will gets knocked unconscious; Philip and Hilary teach Ashley to drive.

Episode.GuestStars: |Brad Garrett|Dennis Burkley|Jim Fyfe|Rusty Schwimmer|Marquita Terry|Tony Pierce|Ellis E. William|
Episode.Overview: Will tells a tall tale about seeing a mob killing, then being placed in a witness-protection program in the backwoods of Alabama.
Will may soon regret using one of his phony lines to snag a sorority recruit; Geoffrey considers legal action for an on-the-job injury.
Ashley secretly abandons her private-school education for the ""real world"" of public education, thanks to inspiration from Will; Hilary tries to broaden her talk show's demographics.

An invitation to a Soul Train reunion has Vivian feeling romantic -- recalling Philip's marriage proposal on the show 25 years earlier -- but has Philip feeling like a dinosaur. Meanwhile, Carlton vies with Will in a dance contest.

Episode.GuestStars: |Pat Morita|Ken Griffey Jr.|Lanier Edwards|Matt Moore|Al Taylor|
Episode.Overview: Lisa humiliates Will by knocking out a guy with her self-defense moves.

Episode.GuestStars: |Jay Leno|Nicole Black|Ian Patrick Williams|John Ridley|James Reeder|
Episode.Overview: Will tries his hand at journalism to prove something to Lisa, but his efforts get him sued for libel -- by Jay Leno.
While on a date with another woman, Will feels the power of love -- for Lisa; and, in a weighted suit, he feels what fitness guru Susan Powter hopes will be empathy for Uncle Philip.
Will goes overboard to make a good first impression on Lisa's father -- and soon regrets it. Meanwhile, Carlton, Ashley and Hilary try to find out who is daddy's favorite by searching for his will.
Will gets roped into a weekend ski trip with Carlton that quickly turns to disaster when their party arrives; meanwhile, back home, Hilary prepares to leave the nest.

Episode.GuestStars: |Ajai Sanders|Cee Cee Michaela|J. Lamont Pope|Louis R. Plante|Michael Soccio|
Episode.Overview: Will and Lisa each lie about their evening plans, then wind up at the same party -- where Ashley is found in the coat room with a football player.
A planned camping trip is cut short for Carlton and Will when a robber approaches them at an automated bank-teller machine -- and fires a gun.
After getting shot, Will proposes marriage to Lisa in a moment of vulnerability; but she shoots him down with ""no"" for an answer. Meanwhile, accident-prone Hilary prolongs Will's recovery.
Thanks to relationship counseling, Will and Lisa hop to move on up to a new understanding in preparation for marriage. Meanwhile Hillary wants Geoffrey to work at her new home.

Episode.GuestStars: |Isaac Hayes|Arnetia Walker-Francis|Cynthena Sanders|Monalisa Young|John Amos|Rolandas Hendricks|Julia Waters|Maxine Waters|Monalisa Young|
Episode.Overview: Will and Lisa have their hearts set on a small wedding, but plans get out of hand when Lisa's dad can't agree on the arrangements -- so the couple elope to Las Vegas.
Will vows Philip with his sound investment advice to buy Jazz's apartment building -- but the tenants scream slumlord after Philip acts on Will's moneymaking tip.
Will inadvertently finds himself in the right place at the right time and lands a part in a daytime soap opera.

Episode.EpisodeName: Save the Last Trance For Me
Episode.Overview: Put into a trance by a stage hypnotist, Will behaves like a 4-year-old just as the family gears up for an interview with the admissions head of a private school.

Episode.EpisodeName: To Thine Own Self Be Blue ... and Gold
Episode.Overview: A dream job for Will with a businessman friend of Philip's turns into a nightmare when the man offers him a bonus to help bribe a councilman.
It's double trouble for Will when a temptress schemes to make him forget his fiancÃ©e -- and also befriends Lisa.
While en route to his bachelor party, Will gets trapped in an elevator with the feuding Carlton and Jazz -- and his life with the women in his past flashes before him (in series clips).

Episode.EpisodeName: For Whom the Wedding Bells Toll
Episode.Overview: Just before the wedding, as tempers heat up between Vy and Fred, Will gets cold feet about marrying Lisa -- whom he feels he may not really know.

Episode.GuestStars: |Robert Munns|Lee Cole|Terrence Evans|Russell Gannon|Danyn Pysz|Darryl Sivad|Denvn Pysz|
Episode.Overview: While Carlton is away at a Young Republican camp, Will cooks up a flambÃ© of a disaster on a night when an influential judge is coming to dinner, and Will can only make it through the night with the help of Geoffrey, and other plan is not to make Phil find out.
In competition with Carlton, Will sets out to prove he's the best man for the job on Hilary's TV show by escorting a famous comedian's sister out on the town.
After learning a little something about initiative, Will jumps to Hilarys' aid prior to a key business meeting at the station; an unemployed Carlton subs for Philip on career day at Ashley's school.

Episode.GuestStars: |Nicole Bilderback|Milo Ventimiglia|B.B. King|Kevin Brief|Chalante Phifer|Yunoka Doyle|Michael Clarke Duncan|Spankee Rogers|Jared Murphy|Marty Parker|Grinnell Morris|
Episode.Overview: The thrill is gone for ""runaway yuppie"" Carlton, who can't handle another disappointment, let alone his long-awaited Princeton interview.

Will decides to book a juror dismissed from Philip's big show-biz madam sex-scandal case for Hilary's show, which results in embarrassment for Judge Banks and some annoying apologies from Will and Hilary.

Episode.GuestStars: |Tamala Jones|Darryl Sivad|Chalante Phifer|Garcelle Beauvais-Nilon|Monica Allison|Jaime Cardriche|
Episode.Overview: When Carlton fines the perfect woman for him, he messes up big time and shes out of the picture for sure. So Will suggests Carlton goes with him on a double date, Carlton has doubts but he owed Will big time (He messed up Will's date earlier that day) so Carlton went with him. Will and Carlton's double date goes great -- until the ""Big"" boyfriend of one of the women shows up.

Episode.EpisodeName: Not With My Cousin You Don't
Episode.Overview: Will and Carlton get a shocking earful when they ""roam the intercom"" system at home and hear Ashley's private conversation -- about sex.

Episode.GuestStars: |Bruce Fine|Gregg Kovan|Susan Bambara|Farrell Mayer|Mike Devey|Deano Georgio|Lisa Nunziella|Wayne Newton|
Episode.Overview: Carlton is on a roll in Vegas, celebrating his birthday at the gaming tables with Will in tow; but suddenly the tables turn, and the duo enter a dance contest to recoup their losses.
Hilary and Carlton volunteer at a homeless shelter on Thanksgiving, while the extended family fills up on holiday treats.

Episode.GuestStars: |Rosey Brown|Zachery Ty Bryan|Jeanine Michelle|Jenifer Lewis|Vernee Watson-Johnson|
Episode.Overview: Will and Philip are arrested at a massage parlor on Thanksgiving; Hilary and Carlton get a lesson in humility at the homeless shelter.
Will plays matchmaker for Hilary, setting her up with his doctor friend, but romance is the last thing on her mind as the anticipates the first national broadcast of ""The Hilary Show"".
Will's New Year's resolution leads him to the gym to get in shape; but when gym-savvy family members take Nicky for some boxing lessons, Will gets cold-cocked by a woman boxer named Helena.

Episode.GuestStars: |Dorien Wilson|Carl Gilliard|Brian Carpenter|Bree Walker|Tim Silva|Donald Welch|
Episode.Overview: It's no laughing matter when a bomb-toting clown holds Philip hostage in the courtroom on the day of the showbiz madam's sentencing.

Episode.EpisodeName: Breaking Up is Hard To Do (1)
Episode.Overview: Philip's recent political involvement doesn't seem to involve Vivian; meanwhile, the owner of a top-modeling agency ""discovers"" Ashley at a fast-food joint.

Episode.EpisodeName: Breaking Up is Hard To Do (2)
Episode.Overview: Breaking up may not be so hard to do for an angry Vivian, but when Philip finds he's lost without her, Will and Carlton conspire to reunite them.

Episode.GuestStars: |Doreen Brown|Darlene Kardon|Larry Marke|Harley McClean|Davida Williams|Paige Tamada|Ashley Monique Clark|Marley McClean|
Episode.Overview: After being accepted at Princeton, a worried Carlton changes his life plans and retreats to a place where everybody knows his name -- the bowling alley.

Geoffrey's life changes overnight when a man claiming to be his long-lost son shows up and charms everyone -- except Will, who discovers the guy's not what he seems. Meanwhile, Hilary starts writing her autobiography, and an early childhood photo reveals a shocking secret.
The church's widowed reverend is a man of esteemed reputation, but not in the eyes of Will -- who spies him making a play for Aunt Vivian.
Dick Clark has a cameo on this backstage outing that has Will Smith visiting with series stars and screening series bloopers.
Philip expects Ashley to decline an offer for what he considers a degrading role in an ad by a director who could also give her a recommendation to a top New York school.

Episode.GuestStars: |Jim Jansen|Gibson Frazier|Arthel Neville|Regis Philbin|Kathie Lee Gifford|Lynn A. Henderson|Toney E. Smith|Stephen Poletti|
Episode.Overview: On Live with Regis and Kathie Lee, Hilary subs for Gifford but doesn't see eye-to-eye with co-host Philbin. Meanwhile, Will subs for Carlton in a golf tourney and gets buddy-buddy with Philip, making Carlton jealous.

William Shatner stars as Hilary's talk-show guest, but Will must find a way to beam him from the dentist's chair to the set. Meanwhile, Hilary's show treks to New York and Ashley insists on tagging along.

Episode.GuestStars: |Gary Coleman|Isabel Sanford|Pat Crawford Brown|Christopher Kirby|Conrad Bain|
Episode.Overview: The series ends its six-year run when the Banks decide to put the mansion up for sale. Family members are on the go, and everyone's ""in the fast lane."" Except for Will, who's stuck on life's ""soft shoulder"" who tells a little lie, that he found a nice apartment. Will lied because he felt that everyone was going on with their lives and he was just staying put in Bel-Air.

Episode.GuestStars: |Gary Coleman|Marla Gibbs|Sherman Hemsley|Pat Crawford Brown|Christopher Kirby|Conrad Bain|Isabel Sanford|
Episode.Overview: The series ends its six-year run when the Banks decide to put the mansion up for sale. Family members are on the go, and everyone's ""in the fast lane."" Except for Will, who's stuck on life's ""soft shoulder"" who tells a little lie, that he found a nice apartment. Will lied because he felt that everyone was going on with their lives and he was just staying put.
